wikipedia_page.main: Charles Piers Egerton Hall, nicknamed Chaz Hall (25 July 1918 – 30 March 1944) was a British pilot who was taken prisoner during the Second World War. He was part of the 'Great Escape' from Stalag Luft III in March 1944, but was captured and subsequently shot by the Gestapo.

response: *Charles Piers Egerton Hall, who became one of the 50 executed and murdered by the Gestapo on the personal orders of Adolf Hitler on 30 March 1944 following "The Great Escape"
* Charles Piers Egerton Hall (1919–1944), RAF pilot and Stalag Luft III escape participant
